responses.rationale: The segment reports bird deaths, not capabilities or preparedness measures.
The segment reports bird deaths, not capabilities or preparedness measures.
Describes monitoring and ensuring access to vaccines ('continuously and actively monitoring', 'ensuring access to over 40 million doses').
The segment describes the spread of the virus, not capabilities or preparedness measures.
The segment explicitly states the risk is low, which is active reassurance (Rule C violation).
Describes securing vaccine doses ('secured 111 million doses'), a preparedness measure.
The segment reports a human case, not capabilities or preparedness measures.
The segment reports a human case and contact, not capabilities or preparedness measures.
The segment describes symptoms and treatment/recovery, not capabilities or preparedness measures.
The segment reports previous human cases, not capabilities or preparedness measures.
The segment describes symptoms of previous cases, not capabilities or preparedness measures.
The segment reports a previous human case, not capabilities or preparedness measures.
The segment reports a human case and explicitly states the risk remains low (Rule C violation).
The segment describes higher risk for certain groups, not capabilities or preparedness measures.
Describes a worker being monitored ('was being monitored'), a surveillance/preparedness measure.
The segment describes test results, not capabilities or preparedness measures.
The segment describes pending results, not capabilities or preparedness measures.
The segment reports infected herds, not capabilities or preparedness measures.
The segment reports an outbreak, not capabilities or preparedness measures.
The segment describes outbreak impact (deaths, slaughter), not capabilities or preparedness measures.
The segment reports human cases, not capabilities or preparedness measures.
The segment defines the illness, not capabilities or preparedness measures.
The segment describes virus jumping hosts, not capabilities or preparedness measures.
The segment describes an outbreak and human cases, not capabilities or preparedness measures.
The segment describes the location of cases, not capabilities or preparedness measures.
The segment states the rarity of human infection, which is active reassurance (Rule C violation).
The segment states the risk is negligible, which is active reassurance (Rule C violation).
The segment describes location and contact of cases, not capabilities or preparedness measures.
The segment describes symptoms, not capabilities or preparedness measures.
The segment describes a future possibility of a pandemic, not capabilities or preparedness measures.
Describes officials investigating genetic changes ('Health officials are investigating'), a preparedness/surveillance measure.
The segment recommends actions to keep safe, which links to present safety (Rule C violation).
The segment is a question, not a statement of capability or preparedness.
The segment reports an outbreak, not capabilities or preparedness measures.
The segment describes outbreak impact (deaths), not capabilities or preparedness measures.
The segment describes disease transmission, not capabilities or preparedness measures.
The segment describes impact (slaughter) and expert concern, not capabilities or preparedness measures.
Describes a country vaccinating birds ('Mexico said this week it would start vaccinating birds'), a preparedness measure.
Describes actions taken ('Animals slaughtered and restrictions introduced'), response measures.
The segment describes spread and industry alert/culling, not capabilities or preparedness measures.
The segment describes attention from epidemiologists, not capabilities or preparedness measures.
The segment reports human infections, not capabilities or preparedness measures.
The segment reports an outbreak, not capabilities or preparedness measures.
Describes action taken ('All animals were slaughtered'), a response measure.
The segment reports an outbreak, not capabilities or preparedness measures.
The segment reports serotype, not capabilities or preparedness measures.
The segment reports an outbreak, not capabilities or preparedness measures.
The segment describes virus circulation/transmission, not capabilities or preparedness measures.
Describes government action ('put the country on increased risk', 'ordering poultry to be kept indoors'), preparedness/response measures.
Describes previous similar actions ('followed a similar move'), context for preparedness/response.

Describes declaration of prevention zone and required biosecurity measures ('prevention zone was declared', 'requiring all bird keepers to follow strict biosecurity measures'), preparedness/response measures.
The segment describes how humans can be affected, not capabilities or preparedness measures.
The segment reports a death, not capabilities or preparedness measures.
Reports a case and quarantine ('leading to a farm being placed in quarantine'), a response measure.
The segment reports strain identification, not capabilities or preparedness measures.
The segment reports WHO advising of a death, not capabilities or preparedness measures.
Describes location within restricted area and existing controls ('within a restricted area where movement controls were already in place'), preparedness/response measures.
Attributes detection to surveillance activities ('attributing it to the "ongoing surveillance activities"'), a preparedness measure.
Recommends housing birds ('housing birds... is an effective method'), advice for preparedness.
Advises following biosecurity practices ('advised bird owners to follow best biosecurity practices'), advice for preparedness.
Notes existing movement controls and extended areas ('existing movement controls remain in place', 'restricted and control areas... have been extended'), preparedness/response measures.
States permits are required for movement ('Permits are required to move birds...'), a preparedness/response measure.
States company is implementing biosecurity measures and following national response ('implementing strict biosecurity measures', 'following the national response'), preparedness/response.
The segment reports a previous discovery of the strain, not capabilities or preparedness measures.
The segment notes viruses can mutate quickly, not capabilities or preparedness measures.
The segment reports details of a death, not capabilities or preparedness measures.
The segment reports details of a death, not capabilities or preparedness measures.
The segment reports source of virus in poultry, not capabilities or preparedness measures.
Describes restrictions applied by APHIS ('APHIS) applied the restriction'), a response measure.
Describes conditions for importing processed products ('can be imported, provided they are accompanied by a permit and a treated as per regulations'), a response/safeguard measure.
Describes culling to limit spread ('will be slaughtered to help limit the spread'), a response measure.
The segment reports the virus was found at farms, not capabilities or preparedness measures.
Explains why entire flock is killed ('entire flock is killed as to keep it from spreading'), a response protocol/safeguard.
Reports number of birds to be killed ('some 26,800 turkeys will be killed', 'nearly 17,000 birds will be slaughtered'), response measures.
The segment describes an ongoing outbreak, not capabilities or preparedness measures.
The segment describes past culling and impact on prices, not capabilities or preparedness measures.
The segment reports the location of the first case this year, not capabilities or preparedness measures.
The segment describes the hardest hit area and culling numbers, not capabilities or preparedness measures.
The segment describes recent cases and virus spread mechanism, not capabilities or preparedness measures.

Describes steps farmers take ('farmers take steps like requiring their workers to change clothes and sanitize their boots', 'limiting the sharing of tools', 'sealing up their facilities'), preparedness/safeguard measures.
The segment reports human cases, not capabilities or preparedness measures.
The segment reports total human cases, not capabilities or preparedness measures.
The segment reports another human case, not capabilities or preparedness measures.
The segment describes spread and concern, not capabilities or preparedness measures.
The segment describes symptoms of a case, not capabilities or preparedness measures.
Describes treatment and isolation of a case ('being treated with antiviral medication and staying home'), response measures.
The segment describes the location of a case, not capabilities or preparedness measures.
The segment describes symptoms of a case, not capabilities or preparedness measures.
The segment reports when cows tested positive, not capabilities or preparedness measures.
The segment explicitly states the risk remains low (Rule C violation).
Describes scientists watching closely ('Scientists are watching closely'), a surveillance/preparedness measure.
Describes FDA testing raw milk ('FDA on Thursday said it would begin testing raw cow's milk'), a surveillance/preparedness measure.
Reports ability to scan wastewater ('reported for the first time the ability to scan wastewater'), a capability/surveillance measure.
Describes scaling up testing of wastewater samples ('has begun scaling up H5-specific testing'), a capability/surveillance measure.
Describes sharing data ('will begin sharing data with local public health officials and on its public dashboard'), part of a surveillance/preparedness system.
The segment describes reluctance to test and lack of information, not capabilities or preparedness measures.
Describes potential benefit of testing wastewater ('could give communities another way to spot potential outbreaks'), a capability/surveillance measure.
The segment is a quote about the usefulness of information, not a statement of capability or preparedness.
Describes developing a probe ('developed a probe that detects H5 influenza viruses'), a capability/development measure.
Describes assay sitting unused and high activity lighting up dashboard, observations related to surveillance.

Describes applying probe to samples and finding viral fragments ('applied the probe to samples', 'found the spikes were mostly due to large amounts of viral fragments'), surveillance/testing activity.
The segment describes a hypothesis, not capabilities or preparedness measures.
The segment reports a human case, not capabilities or preparedness measures.
The segment reports publication of results, not capabilities or preparedness measures.
Reports finding sequences in wastewater in another study ('researchers... began finding H5N1 sequences in wastewater'), a surveillance/testing activity.
Describes boost to wastewater monitoring capacity ('nation's wastewater monitoring capacity got a huge boost'), a capability/preparedness statement.
Describes CDC operating a surveillance system ('CDC operates the National Wastewater Surveillance System, which monitors 600 sites'), a capability/preparedness statement.
Describes CDC releasing data on a dashboard ('CDC began releasing data... on a public dashboard'), part of a surveillance/preparedness system.
Describes how high levels of influenza A in wastewater could be a reliable indicator ('could be a reliable indicator that something unusual is going on'), utility of a surveillance method.
Describes CDC launching a dashboard ('CDC launching wastewater dashboard'), a capability/preparedness statement.
Describes how the CDC map provides context ('CDC serves up current levels... providing needed context'), utility of a surveillance tool.
Describes agency working with partners to investigate ('agency works with state and local partners to investigate further'), a response protocol/preparedness measure.

Describes CDC communicating with groups to understand value of testing ('agency is in communication... to better understand the potential value of more widespread testing'), related to improving surveillance/preparedness.

Quote about reviewing data/methodologies to improve surveillance ('continuing to review data and methodologies that may improve our public health surveillance'), related to improving surveillance/preparedness.
The segment describes what the field needs to learn, not existing capabilities or preparedness measures.
The segment describes data that authorities are hungry for, not capabilities or preparedness measures.
The segment is a question about interpreting data, not a statement of capability or preparedness.
The segment describes interest in a method, not capabilities or preparedness measures.
The segment is a related article title, not a statement of capability or preparedness.
Describes scientists sequencing virus from milk ('scientists have begun sequencing the bird flu virus from store-bought milk as a way to monitor its movement'), a surveillance/research activity.
The segment reports a human case, not capabilities or preparedness measures.
The segment explicitly states the risk remains low (Rule C violation).
The segment describes evolutionary capacity and increased potential risks, not capabilities or preparedness measures.
The segment describes patient hospitalization, not capabilities or preparedness measures.
Describes sample confirmation by CDC ('a sample was sent to the agency, where it was confirmed'), a testing/surveillance activity.
The segment explicitly states the risk remains low (Rule C violation).
The segment describes potential for genetic reassortment, not capabilities or preparedness measures.
The segment describes a potential future virus scenario, not capabilities or preparedness measures.
States agency aims 'to do everything we can' to reduce risk, a statement of effort/capability.
Reports culling ('250,000 birds were euthanized'), a response measure.
The segment describes the decision based on concerns/tests, not capabilities or preparedness measures.
The segment reports confirmation by department, not capabilities or preparedness measures.
Announces a new vaccine helping protect birds ('a new vaccine... has helped protect them'), a capability/development/safeguard measure.
Urges poultry owners to call a hotline ('urging poultry owners... to call the CDFA Sick Bird Hotline'), a preparedness/surveillance measure.
The segment reports scientists warning people, not capabilities or preparedness measures.
The segment describes virus crossing a new frontier, not capabilities or preparedness measures.
The segment describes a development raising concerns, not capabilities or preparedness measures.
The segment describes outbreak location and rise in deaths, not capabilities or preparedness measures.
The segment reports number of deaths and transmission, not capabilities or preparedness measures.
Describes genomic analysis revealing clades ('used genomic analysis to reveal'), a research/surveillance activity.
Describes researchers finding mutations ('Researchers found identical mutations'), a research/surveillance activity.
The segment is a quote about the implication of a finding, not a statement of capability or preparedness.
The segment is a quote about potential future implications, not capabilities or preparedness measures.
The segment describes a characteristic of the virus, not capabilities or preparedness measures.
The segment describes past spread, not capabilities or preparedness measures.
The segment describes past spread, not capabilities or preparedness measures.
The segment is a quote about a characteristic of viruses, not capabilities or preparedness measures.
The segment is a quote about a characteristic of the virus, not capabilities or preparedness measures.
Authors stressed importance of continued research ('stressed the importance of continued research'), a preparedness measure.

The segment is a quote about increased risk, not capabilities or preparedness measures.
The segment is a quote about factors facilitating spread, not capabilities or preparedness measures.
The segment is a quote about factors creating a 'perfect storm', not capabilities or preparedness measures.
The segment describes exposure and lack of resources, not capabilities or preparedness measures.
The segment describes symptoms of cases, not capabilities or preparedness measures.

Describes potential benefits of surveillance ('By keeping tabs on farmworkers, researchers could track infections, learn how dangerous they are, and be alerted'), hopeful future possibilities enabled by a measure.
The segment is a quote expressing a belief, not a statement of capability or preparedness.
The segment is a quote criticizing a surveillance method, not describing a capability or preparedness measure itself.
Reports people being 'actively monitored' ('others are being 'actively monitored' for symptoms'), a preparedness/surveillance measure.
Announces a program to facilitate testing ('announced they would pay farmworkers $75 each to be tested', 'offers incentives for farm owners to allow testing'), a preparedness measure.
Describes the purpose of an incentive payment ('compensates workers for their time contributing to the monitoring'), describing the purpose of a preparedness measure.
The segment notes the CDC believes the risk is low (Rule C violation).
The segment describes a potential instruction and inability to afford it, not capabilities or preparedness measures.
The segment is a quote commenting on a program, not a statement of capability or preparedness.
Says health officials would provide medical care ('health officials would provide short-term medical care'), a response/treatment capability.
The segment is a quote about workers' concerns, not capabilities or preparedness measures.
The segment describes fear of attention, not capabilities or preparedness measures.
The segment describes historical context, not capabilities or preparedness measures.
The segment describes historical context, not capabilities or preparedness measures.
The segment says workers have been told very little, not capabilities or preparedness measures.
The segment is a quote recommending education, not stating an existing capability or preparedness measure.
The segment is a quote recommending how conversations should be conducted, not stating an existing capability or preparedness measure.
Describes CDC asking states to share PPE ('CDC asked states... to share personal protective equipment'), a preparedness/response measure.
Says state health departments have offered to distribute equipment ('all said they have offered to distribute such equipment'), a preparedness/response measure.
Says farms requested protective equipment from state stockpile ('four dairy farms had requested protective equipment from the state stockpile'), utilization of a preparedness resource.
The segment is a quote commenting on equipment offerings, not stating a capability or preparedness measure.
The segment is a quote recommending a better option, not stating an existing capability or preparedness measure.
The segment describes other workers facing potential infection, not capabilities or preparedness measures.

The segment is a quote describing exposure, not capabilities or preparedness measures.

The segment reports WHO/CDC saying there has been an increase in mammal outbreaks, not capabilities or preparedness measures.
The segment reports a human case, not capabilities or preparedness measures.

The segment describes exposure source of previous cases, not capabilities or preparedness measures.

Describes USDA stepping up surveillance efforts ('US Department of Agriculture has also stepped up surveillance efforts'), a preparedness/surveillance measure.
The segment describes an unknown, not capabilities or preparedness measures.
